sentences.en: Alarmed, Hung - chien urged her to rouse herself a little so as not to disappoint Hsin - mei .
sentences.cn: 鸿 渐 发急,劝她勉强振作一下,别辜负 辛楣 的盛意.

sentences.en: He closed the door softly so that he should not rouse anybody.
sentences.cn: 他关门很轻,以免吵醒别人.

sentences.en: He did more to rouse the crowd there than anybody else.
sentences.cn: 他比其他任何人都更积极地鼓动那里的群众。

sentences.en: He had slumped into a state of torpor from which nothing could rouse him.
sentences.cn: 他陷入麻木状态，任何事都不能令他振奋。

sentences.en: He took one look and then flew to rouse out his forces.
sentences.cn: 他望了一眼,就如飞而去,把他的大队人马召集起来.

sentences.en: He was perfectly exhausted and they were careful not to rouse him.
sentences.cn: 他完全疲惫不堪了,他们也就想尽办法不要把他吵醒.
他重重的关门声把邻居都吵醒了。

sentences.en: I usually rouse at six in the morning.
sentences.cn: 我通常在早晨6点钟醒来.

sentences.en: It's time to rouse the children.
Rarities are always helped by any device which will rouse curiosity and compel remark.
sentences.cn: 只要上面有能激发好奇心并已让人不得不看的印迹,这种精品总是好卖的.

sentences.en: She must rouse herself from the torpor of mind and body.
sentences.cn: 她精神和肉体都已疲乏,现在必须振作起来了.

sentences.en: She seemed to be unable to rouse herself to do anything.
sentences.cn: 她似乎打不起精神去做任何事情。

sentences.en: The knocking was loud and long, but it failed to rouse the drowsy inmates.
sentences.cn: 敲门的声音又响又长, 但是敲不醒里面睡熟了的人们.

sentences.en: The uproar was enough to rouse both the quick and the dead.
sentences.cn: 这喧嚣声足以惊醒生者和死者.

sentences.en: You must rouse yourself to action.
sentences.cn: 你必须振作精神,起来行动.

words.tran_cn: 活泼的；使奋起的；使感动的

trans.tran_cn: 叫醒，惊醒，鼓励，鼓舞，使发脾气，使振奋
trans.tran_en: to wake someone who is sleeping deeply

trans.tran_cn: 惊起； 唤起； 唤醒
trans.tran_en: to wake someone who is sleeping deeply
to wake someone who is sleeping deeply
to wake someone who is sleeping deeply
